title: Cloverfield Steadi-cam VERTIGO Edition
description:
***DISCLAIMER***

I did this as an experiment; my goal here is not to redistribute copyrighted matrerial, or \&#039;pirate\&#039; the film.
I\&#039;ve made my own, \&#039;watchable\&#039; version, aimed at someone *really* sensitive to motion sickness. And I\&#039;m sharing it as an experiment. Without this, I would not have been able to watch this fun film. 

Believe me, I tried.


Ok, here\&#039;s the deal: 

I have mild MÃƒÆ’?Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â©niÃƒÆ’?Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¨re\&#039;s disease, the actual medical condition that causes spells of dizziness, often triggered by motion.

I really wanted to see this movie, but didn\&#039;t want to barf, or even take the chance that feeling nauseous would discract from the pace/energy of the film.

So, I \"steadied\" the entire movie using the excellent virtualdub plugin DeShaker. I highly reccommend it for your own home movies. (http://www.guthspot.se/video/deshaker.htm)

Conclusions:

The process actually worked quite well. What you will see, is that because the shooting is so wild/freehand, steadying the content makes the \&#039;frame\&#039; of the movie swing and rotate in the exact opposite way. Watch the timecode move at the beginning to see how wild the camera work is. It\&#039;s for that reason that I cropped about 10% of the actual frame. If you have a zoom control on your DVD remote, you may want to use it a little to eliminate some of the border swing. You\&#039;ll see what I mean when you try it.

That said, this isn\&#039;t perfect,  don\&#039;t yell at me because its not a perfect rip. That\&#039;s not the point. I did this as an experiment, and I\&#039;ll tell you what, for me, it actually worked, despite the distraction of the frame moving. Someone with vertigo will actually rather have the frame move than the content. 

You\&#039;ll also see things you missed, because the camera now keeps the main subject(s) centered.

I\&#039;m currently working on a multi-angle DVD so you can swap between both versions on the fly, just for fun. Stay tuned.

Coded with virtualdub/deshaker/XVID.

Please comment and let me know your thoughts.
